pullRequest.title: [JENKINS-61478] Style improvements to alert banners
pullRequest.bodyText:
See JENKINS-61478.
Recent changes have caused the alert banners to look broken (their height no loner matching the navbar height). This was a good excuse to try to improve them, so apart from  fixing the height in my first commit, I also experimented a bit, copying the styles from bootstrap alerts, removing the opacity and switching to material icons. The fade-in and fade-out effects remain, as well as the duration of the alert.
Screenshots
In the Jira ticket, the steps to reproduce the "success" and "copied" (default) alerts were described. In the following screenshots you can see the "before" and "after" for each case.
Success alert ("apply")
Before:

After (using "alert-success" styles from bootstrap and the check_circle icon from material icons):

Default alert ("copied")
The use case for copying an API token, described in the Jira ticket, corresponds to the default alert.
Before:

After (using the "alert-info" styles from boostrap):

Warning and Error alerts
Apart from the two cases described above and reported in the ticket, I've noticed there are also "warning" and "error" alerts. I was not able to reproduce a behavior that will trigger warning or error alerts. However, I did modify the styles and tested them by temporarily replacing the "success" alert with these other two.
Before:


After (using the corresponding bootstrap styles and material icon "help_outline" for warning, and "highlight_off" for error):


Proposed changelog entries

Style improvements on alert banners

Proposed upgrade guidelines
N/A
Submitter checklist

 JIRA issue is well described
 Changelog entries and upgrade guidelines are appropriate for the audience affected by the change (users or developer, depending on the change). Examples

Fill-in the Proposed changelog entries section only if there are breaking changes or other changes which may require extra steps from users during the upgrade


 Appropriate autotests or explanation to why this change has no tests
 For dependency updates: links to external changelogs and, if possible, full diffs

Desired reviewers
@fqueiruga
@daniel-beck
@josephbrueggen
@uhafner
@batmat
Maintainer checklist
Before the changes are marked as ready-for-merge:

 There are at least 2 approvals for the pull request and no outstanding requests for change
 Conversations in the pull request are over OR it is explicit that a reviewer does not block the change
 Changelog entries in the PR title and/or Proposed changelog entries are correct
 Proper changelog labels are set so that the changelog can be generated automatically
 If the change needs additional upgrade steps from users, upgrade-guide-needed label is set and there is a Proposed upgrade guidelines section in the PR title. (example)
 If it would make sense to backport the change to LTS, a JIRA issue should exist and be labeled as lts-candidate

commit.message:
[JENKINS-61478] Using bootstrap alert-success colors

Apart from background color, including text color and border color. Also, removing opacity.

[JENKINS-61478] Using "info" alert styles as default

Copied the colors from the "info" alert in bootstrap for the default
[JENKINS-61478] Refactoring default alert styles to attribute

nodes.bodyText: Did you try to see if the styles that are not opacity can be moved into CSS classes? Maybe we can use a .alert-banner.alert-banner-warning style.
As I mentioned before, I think it would be better to move as much as possible to CSS
Maybe you could add a second CSS class to the icons and make them. They feel a bit underwhelming right now, maybe you could try increasin the size to 2rem or 2.5rem

commit.message: [JENKINS-61478] Adding icon colors matching material-ui alerts
[JENKINS-61478] Added default icon and icon color to alerts
[JENKINS-61478] Moving alert styles and animations to CSS
[JENKINS-61478] Also moving alert height and display to CSS
[JENKINS-61478] Fine-tune alert animations & add vendor prefixes
